text: When the LORD smelled the sweet odor, the LORD said to himself: Never again will I curse the ground because of human beings, since the desires of the human heart are evil from youth; nor will I ever again strike down every living being, as I have done.
Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Go sacrifice to your God within the land.”

After the inner organs and the shanks were washed with water, Moses burned these remaining parts of the ram on the altar. It was a burnt offering for a sweet aroma, an oblation to the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
When the Levites had purified themselves and washed their garments, Aaron presented them as an elevated offering before the LORD, and made atonement for them to cleanse them.
for when Joshua and the main body of Israelites saw that the city had been taken by ambush and was going up in smoke, they struck back at the forces of Ai.

Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Come, kill us yourself, for as a man is, so is his strength.” So Gideon stepped forward and killed Zebah and Zalmunna. He also took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.
Samuel listened to all the concerns of the people and then repeated them to the LORD.
I have provided there a place for the ark in which is the covenant of the LORD that he made with our ancestors when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.”

Thereupon Joram with all his chariots crossed over to Zair. He arose by night and broke through the Edomites when they had surrounded him and the commanders of his chariots. Then his army fled homeward.
Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
Then I proclaimed a fast, there by the river of Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God to seek from him a safe journey for ourselves, our children, and all our possessions.

Now take half of what I own here; go back in good health to your father. The other half will be yours when I and my wife die. Take courage, son! I am your father, and Edna is your mother; we belong to you and to your sister both now and forever. So take courage, son!”
If we are taken, then all Judea will fall, our sanctuary will be plundered, and God will demand an account from us for their profanation.

He will pass through it hard-pressed and hungry, and when hungry, shall become enraged, and curse king and gods. He will look upward,
I am broken by the injury of the daughter of my people. I am in mourning; horror has seized me.
The he-goat is the king of the Greeks, and the great horn on its forehead is the first king.
and the inhabitants of one city will approach those of another, and say, “Come! let us go to implore the favor of the LORD and to seek the LORD of hosts. I too am going.”
Another of [his] disciples said to him, “Lord, let me go first and bury my father.”
He said to them, “Do you still not understand?” The Blind Man of Bethsaida.
He said to them in reply, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and act on it.” The Calming of a Storm at Sea.
He said to them again, “I am going away and you will look for me, but you will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come.”
You have no share or lot in this matter, for your heart is not upright before God.

for we are concerned for what is honorable not only in the sight of the Lord but also in the sight of others.
